poem:
Casino Dawn in New York  

In Queens and the Bronx, dice roll  
Where Ailanthus trees once grew—  
Concrete blooms now tower tall,  
Gold flickers in gray morning light.  

Hope rides the subway,  
Clutching dreams spun from cards.  
Coins clash, like whispered promises  
Dancing across the Hudson,  
While down streets,  
Silent, fog thickens.
